node.title: Hobart shivers through likely coldest November night in over 60 years, wakes to snow
node.alt: Snow covers a timber deck and outdoor table and chair
node.description: It was meant to be late spring, but temperatures in Hobart dropped to 2.9 degrees last night and many people woke to snow falling in their backyards.
node.content:
["Tasmanians in some parts of the state have woken to snow-blanketed yards as a late spring cold snap caused snow to fall as low as 200 metres.", "Initial data shows the temperature in Hobart fell to 2.9 degrees Celsius overnight \u2014\u00a0which would make it the city's coldest November night since 1953.", "The Bureau of Meteorology's Luke Johnston said the record would be verified on Monday, along with other minimum temperature records across the state.", "Mr Johnston said up to 30 centimetres of snow fell about the Western and Central Plateau districts, and there were also falls in the north-east highlands.", "", "
Residents of Waratah in Tasmania's north-west found their yards blanketed in snow.(Supplied: Twitter/Leanne Stap)
", "", "
Snow on the Huon Highway at Vinces Saddle.(Supplied: Nick Monk)
", "\"The lowest snow would have fallen about the southern parts of Tasmania, but due to the elevated nature of the Central Plateau and some of the ranges in the west of Tasmania, they actually got more snow in the end, or very likely to have had more snow in the end, because they're just that much higher above sea level,\" he said.", "Mr Johnston said the cold south-westerly air had come up from Antarctica.", "", "
Waratah was one of the areas of Tasmania to receive a late spring snowfall.(Supplied: Twitter/Leanne Stap)
"]
